file.name: Passwords02Hashing
file.title: Hashing
file.bullet: The best practice for handling users credentials is by hashing their passwords.
How is hashing different from encrypting?
Hashing is applying an irreversible mathematical function to an input string to produce an output string.
Why is it important that the function is irreversible?
A reversible function is called encryption.
In contrast to encryption, once you hash something, the original input value cannot be retrieved.
So how is it useful, if the password can not be retrieved?
Using fancy mathematical means, we can verify that two hashes came from the same original input.
You can't take a smoothie and get back the original ingredients, but, given two different smoothies, you can tell if they came from the same ingredients.
